required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Long-Term Safety of ZX008 (Fenfluramine Hydrochloride) Oral Solution in Children and Adults With Epileptic Encephalopathy Including Dravet Syndrome and Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Extension Trial to Assess the Long-Term Safety of ZX008 (Fenfluramine Hydrochloride) Oral Solution as an Adjunctive Therapy for Seizures in Patients With Rare Seizure Disorders Such as Epileptic Encephalopathies Including Dravet Syndrome and Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome

collaborator.agency: Zogenix International Limited, Inc., a subsidiary of Zogenix, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: This is an international, multicenter, open-label, long-term safety study of ZX008 in subjects with Dravet syndrome, Lennox-Gastaut syndrome or epileptic encephalopathy

detailed_description.textblock: This is an international, multicenter, open-label, long-term safety study of ZX008 in patients with epileptic encephalopathy, including Dravet syndrome or Lennox-Gastaut syndrome. Subjects eligible for participation are those with Dravet syndrome who are currently enrolled in Study ZX008-1503, or those with Lennox-Gastaut syndrome who have successfully completed Study ZX008-1601-Part 2, and are candidates for continued treatment with ZX008 for an extended period of time, or those with Dravet syndrome, Lennox-Gastaut syndrome, or another epileptic encephalopathy who have completed participation in another Zogenix-sponsored study and have been invited to participate in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events leading to study withdrawal in subjects receiving open label ZX008
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long term safety and tolerability of oral dose administration of ZX008
The analysis will include abnormal hematology and chemistry laboratory results outside of reference ranges
The analysis will include change in heart rate using standard measure
The analysis will include change in resting respiratory rate using standard measure
The analysis will include change in resting blood pressure using standard measure
The analysis will include change in body weight and height by report of BMI in kg/m^2
The analysis will include changes in heart beat as measured with 12-lead electrocardiogram
The analysis will include change in heart valves as measured with standard echocardiogram

secondary_outcome.description: The analysis will include percent improvement per investigator rating

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive CGI by Parent/Caregiver
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by parent/caregiver of the patient's change in cognitive symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Behavioral CGI by Parent/Caregiver
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by parent/caregiver of the patient's change in behavioral symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Motor CGI by Parent/Caregiver
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by parent/caregiver of the patient's change in motor symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive CGI by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by investigator of the patient's change in cognitive symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Behavioral CGI by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by investigator of the patient's change in behavioral symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Motor CGI by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by investigator of the patient's change in motor symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression by Parent/Caregiver
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by parent/caregiver of the patient's overall change in symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse"

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: The rating by investigator of the patient's overall change in symptoms since the beginning of study as "very much improved", "much improved", "minimally improved", "no change", "minimally worse", "much worse", or "very much worse"

arm_group.description: ZX008 is supplied as an open-label oral solution.Doses will include up to 0.8 mg/kg/day divided into 2 daily doses, up to a maximum of 30 mg/day (subjects taking concomitant STP will receive up to 0.5 mg/kg/day, up to a maximum of 20 mg/day) in a concentration of 2.5 mg/mL.

intervention.description: Fenfluramine hydrochloride provided in a concentration of 2.5 mg/mL.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or nonpregnant, nonlactating female
- Satisfactory completion of a core study
- Has a rare seizure disorder, such as epileptic encephalopathy and has successfully completed another Zogenix-sponsored clinical trials with ZX008
- Subject's caregiver is willing and able to be compliant with study procedures, visit schedule and study drug accountability
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current cardiac valvulopathy or pulmonary hypertension that is clinically significant
- Moderate or severe hepatic impairment
- Receiving monoamine oxidase inhibitors, serotonin agonists, serotonin antagonists, and serotonin reuptake inhibitors within 14 days of receiving ZX008

facility.name: Clinical Integrative Research Center of Atlanta, Panda Neurology
Institute of Neurology and Neurosurgery at St. Barnabas
